features: 【Powerful Cleaning】: Perfect for washing T-shirts, baby clothes, underwear or socks and other small clothes, not recommended to wash large pieces of clothing
【Upgraded Turbo】: We use a higher power turbo, one minute of forward rotation, one minute of reverse rotation, 16 minutes to complete the wash
【Compact and Convenient】: 4.0in*4.0in*2.7in size, can be easily put into the suitcase, perfect for travelling, business trips or use in the flat
【Product Material】: The mini washing machine is made of environmentally friendly PP and TPR materials. It is safe, non-toxic and odourless, you can use it without any worries

【Easy to Use】Use the suction cups to fix the portable washing machine to the bottom or edge of the bucket or sink, put in small clothes and detergent and add water, then turn on the power to start washing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good for the price
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I got this for a senior relative that doesn’t have a dishwasher. He also has used it to wash small clothing items. He does the job & saves him time washing everything by hand. I bought another for a friend based on his experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars How do you use it safely?
reviews.reviewText: I was excited to order this, but somewhat disappointed when it arrived. Although it seems sturdy, the cord goes directly into the unit, and there are no specifics on how to safely use it. Is it going to be the same thing as electrocuting someone by dropping a toaster into a bathtub like in old movies? I think the cord is supposed to come out the top. The instructions also said something about turning it off, but it did not seem like there was a way to do that other than simply unplugging, so I was confused. It does not have a UL listed indicator.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works pretty well.
reviews.reviewText: Although I've only had mine for less than 4 days: I used mine to clean 4 vacuum-cleaner-filters and maybe 11 wash rags covered in kerosene-soot and sawdust and it works pretty nicely so far. Basically anything that I don't want in my real washing machine.For something as dirty as a vacuum-cleaner-filter you'll definitely need to empty and refill a bucket two or three times because the water will turn BLACK the first two times. But yes, it will get them clean.Then rinse the excess soap off in a sink, wring them out and dry them. Done!This particular washing machine will stop running after about 15 minutes so you'll have to re-plug it to run more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is the first time using portable washer! I like it and it does great job

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Useful for travel
reviews.reviewText: So first off, don't let the definite article fool you. This is just the white agitator device. All that talk about 'the bucket' makes you think it comes with a bucket. It does not. Just make sure you know that!I used it in the manner in which I would be using it--travel. I brought it on a recent trip and it was handy. If you use it in the bathroom sink, you want to set it vertically (as shown) and that might give you one place to put it--on the very back of the sink. And you might not be able to fill up the sink to cover the whole thing because bathroom sinks in hotels are now tiny for some reason?Anyway, I used it for two pairs of undies and two pairs of socks, and used shampoo instead of laundry detergent, because, like I said, realistic travel scenario, I'm not going to bring a bag of strange white powder in my luggage, if you know what I mean. I did that in the 1990s and...never again.It was a bit splashy (I had to dry down the counter with a towel) but it worked surprisingly well. The water got dirty looking and my socks and undies once they dried smelled clean and fresh after air drying over the shower curtain.This will not replace my home laundry machine, and honestly until or unless I travel with a bucket, it's got a small capacity--maybe a tee shirt's worth, because of the sink capacity. I also don't know how I'd trust it with significant stains like oil or chocolate (but that's more on the pretreatment than anything else). But if you're just trying to freshen up your unmentionables, or you forgot a spare pair of socks, this is great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Pros:1. It's portable.2. It spins well for an item of its size.3. The suction for attachment is really strong.4. Set it and forget it washing.Cons:1. Mainly useful for light-weight clothing.2. Only about 3 articles of regular weight clothing will spin well.3. Must be used in a taller bucket/sink otherwise water will splatter.Although there are more pros than cons, it is those cons that made this washer a deal breaker for me. My first attempt was to wash two, regular weight socks, and one light weight pair of underwear. I thought the cleaning was doing well, so then I added another pair of cotton underwear to the mix. Once added, the clothing became congested and stuck. I kept fixing this and finally decided to leave the wash cycle alone to see if it would regulate itself. It did, but took some time.Ultimately, the clothing didn't come out the cleanest, even after two complete wash cycles. In theory the idea of this item is nice, but the follow through wasn't all I thought it would be.

reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars its not what i thought
reviews.reviewText: its wired, not wireless and so its limited on where you can use it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works Great In Deeper Buckets
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. The mini portable washer is a good product that does work. It didnt work to well in the sink where I first tried it out. Maybe for a small item it will work in the sink. I tried it for a couple of work tee shirts. The items kept gavitating to the washer and getting stuck on it causing the motor to stop. It did restart automatically once the item was removed off of it, but it got kinda annoying. The washer is powerful but a little loud. Im going to try it in a 5 gallon bucket and a collapsible dish pan when using to wash more items together and hope for a better outcome.
